org.nzdis.micro

Class SystemAgentLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.SystemAgentLoader

  • public final class SystemAgentLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Default System-wide AgentLoader.

    SystemAgentLoader.java
    Created: Thu Mar 15 14:44:00 2001
    Version:
    $Revision: 2.0 $ $Date: 2013/04/08 00:00:00 $
    Author:
    Mariusz Nowostawski (Original author), Christopher Frantz (Revision author)

    • Method Detail

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role role)
        Instantiate an Agent for a given Role. This method will create an Agent object with the given role capability.
        Parameters:
        role - Role implementation to be played by the instantiated agent
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role role,
                                             java.lang.String name)
        Variant for newAgent() with option to provide agent name.
        Parameters:
        role - Role implementation to be played by the instantiated agent
        name - Name for created agent
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role role,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             boolean useNameAsPrefix)
        Variant of newAgent() with played role, agent name and option to use passed name only as prefix for actual agent name (suffix determined by platform).
        Parameters:
        role - Role to be initialized on newly created agent
        name - Name for created agent
        useNameAsPrefix - Indicator if name should only be used as prefix for actual name (generated by platform)
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role role,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             boolean useNameAsPrefix,
                                             java.lang.String cljScript)
        Variant of newAgent() with played role, agent name and option to use passed name only as prefix for actual agent name (suffix determined by platform). Additionally the name of a Clojure script holding the agent implementation can be passed.
        Parameters:
        role - Role to be initialized on newly created agent
        name - Name for created agent
        useNameAsPrefix - Indicator if name should only be used as prefix for actual name (generated by platform)
        cljScript - Clojure script to be loaded for agent
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role role,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String cljScript)
        Variant of newAgent() with played role and agent name. Additionally the name of a Clojure script holding the agent implementation can be passed.
        Parameters:
        role - Role to be initialized on newly created agent
        name - Name for created agent
        cljScript - Clojure script to be loaded for agent
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role[] roles)
        Instantiates an Agent for given Roles. This method will create an Agent object with the given roles capability.
        Parameters:
        roles - Roles array implementation, all roles o be played by the instantiated agent
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role[] aRoleArray,
                                             java.lang.String name)
        Instantiates an Agent for given Roles. This method will create an Agent object with the given roles capability. Additionally an agent name can be specified.
        Parameters:
        aRoleArray - Array of roles assigned to newly created agent
        name - Name for created agent
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role[] aRoleArray,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             boolean useNameAsPrefix,
                                             java.lang.String cljScript)
        Instantiates an agent for the given roles on SystemOwner level. An agent name can be passed. If indicated, the agent name will only be prefix of the actual name which is determined by the platform at runtime. A reference to the Clojure script for an agent implementation can be provided.
        Parameters:
        aRoleArray - Array of roles assigned to newly created agent
        name - Name for created agent
        useNameAsPrefix - Indicator if name is only to be used as prefix which is completed by platform
        cljScript - Clojure script to be loaded with agent instance
        Returns:
        AgentController to manage created agent

      • newAgent

        public static final AgentController newAgent(Role[] aRoleArray,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String cljScript)
        Instantiates an agent for the given roles on SystemOwner level. An agent name can be passed. A reference to the Clojure script for an agent implementation can be provided.
        Parameters:
        aRoleArray - Array of roles to be assigned to newly created agent
        name - Name for created agent
        cljScript - Clojure script used for implementation
        Returns:

      • newAgent

        public static final Agent newAgent(java.lang.Class agentclass)
        Instantiate an Agent for a given Agent class. This method will create an Agent instance directly via the default agent constructor. Note, that the user defined agent implementation does not need to implement AgentController; it is up to the programmer to decided the most efficient mechanism for agent controlling.
        Parameters:
        agentclass - Class of the agent to be instantiated
        Returns:
        newly created agent instance or null if the agent cannot be instantiated

      • newAgent

        public static final Agent newAgent(Agent anAgent)
        Registers an instantiated agent with the platform, in the SystemOwner group.
        Parameters:
        anAgent -
        Returns:

      • findRoles

        public static final Role[] findRoles(java.lang.Class roleType)
        Finds all working roles for a given role type along the entire agent hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        roleType - Class of the role to be found.
        Returns:
        Array of roles which are of the exact type or subtypes of a specified role type

      • findRolesByIntent

        public static final Role[] findRolesByIntent(java.lang.Class intentType)
        Finds all working roles for a given intent type along the entire agent hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        intentType - Class of the intent type to be looked up.
        Returns:
        Array of roles that can satisfy the given intent.

      • findAgentsByRole

        public static final Agent[] findAgentsByRole(java.lang.Class roleType)
        Finds all working agents for a given role type along the entire agent hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        roleType - Class of the role type to be looked up.
        Returns:
        Array of agents that play a given role type.

      • findAgentNamesByRole

        public static final java.lang.String[] findAgentNamesByRole(java.lang.Class roleType)
        Finds all working agents' names for a given role type along the entire agent hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        roleType - Class of the role type to be looked up.
        Returns:
        Array of agent names that play a given role type.

      • findAgentsByIntent

        public static final Agent[] findAgentsByIntent(java.lang.Class intentType)
        Finds all existing Agents for a given intent type along the entire agent hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        intentType - Intent type Class for the intents to be found
        Returns:
        Array of Agents providing roles for a specified intent type
